name: Tributary Inflow Condition
functionStatement: Quantity + quality of inflow (tributaries, ditches, and pipes) does not provide harmful peaks or pollution, and supports diverse habitat conditions.
descriptionMarkdown: Tributaries stable, matching reference (flow, quality, form), with no major flash/pollution surges.
howToMeasureMarkdown: At confluences, visually assess flow stability and turbidity. Supplement with available impairment lists and local monitoring data.

inputs.label: Tributary Inflow Condition
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Tributaries are mostly natural with stable flows and sediment loads consistent with reference conditions. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: 1-2 tributaries are moderately altered or somewhat polluted. / Multiple tributaries are significantly altered and deliver high sediment or pollutants. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Widespread severe tributary impacts that overwhelm the mainstem. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)

references: Field observations with turbidity tube or meter
